purpleculture_pinyin:
shā
to brake
тормозить

chà
Buddhist monastery, temple or shrine (abbr. for 刹多罗 , Sanskrit "ksetra")
Буддийский монастырь, храм или святыня (сокр. От 刹 多 罗, санскрит «кшетра»)
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 刹)
Pictophonetic: 杀 indicates the sound; 刂 (knife) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
剎車 [ shā chē ]: to brake (when driving); to stop; to switch off; to check (bad habits); a brake
剎把 [ shā bǎ ]: brake lever; crank handle for stopping or turning off machinery
剎住 [ shā zhù ]: to stop; to come to a halt
剎那 [ chà nà ]: an instant (Sanskrit: ksana); split second; the twinkling of an eye
剎時 [ chà shí ]: in a flash; in the twinkling of an eye
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 杀 [ shā ] to kill, to murder, to slaughter; to hurt
    • 刂 [ dāo ] knife
heisig_chinese_memo: Wolverine waiting atop a tree to spring down on Sabretooth at any moment. He always jumps too soon so the Sabretooth can brake and sprint in the other direction.
Ru_trainchinese:
shā: (глаг) останавливать, тормозить
chà: (графема) буддийский храм
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Wolverine waiting atop a tree to spring down on Sabretooth at any moment. He always jumps to soon so the Sabretooth can brake and sprint in the other direction.
humanum_full_description_en:
From the " knife " and "to kill " to the provincial sound, it means the transliteration of the Sanskrit word ksetra (ksetra), which can mean land, country, or world. "Huayan Sutra‧ Entering the Dharma Realm": "Strictly clean all the temples and eliminate the three evil ways." It also means the ornaments on the top of the stupa, also known as the pillars. "Shuowen New Attachment": "The column also. From the knife, not detailed. Kill the province." The Northern Wei Dynasty Yang Xuan's "Luoyang Jialan Ji·Yongning Temple": "There is a nine-story floating map in the middle, and a wooden frame is ninety high. It is ten feet high with a brake, and a thousand feet together."

" Sha " can also refer to a stupa. "The Book of Southern Qi‧The Biography of Liangzheng‧Yu Yuan": "The emperor used his old residence to build the Xianggong Temple. It was extremely extravagant. With filial piety and martial dignity, the emperor wanted to rise up to ten floors, and could not stand. It was divided into two temples, each with five floors. "

" Sha " also refers to Buddhist temples. Tang Gu Kuang "A Trip to Qinglong Temple Alone": "The spring breeze enters the incense temple, and in his free day he travels alone.

" Sha " also means a very short moment. Southern Dynasty Liang Shenyue "Ode to a Thousand Buddhas": "Stop for a moment, three thoughts go together."
humanum_short_description_en: From " sword " and "to kill ", it means the transliteration of the Sanskrit name for Shadala.
humanum_full_description:
從「刀」，「殺」省聲，表示梵語剎多羅（ksetra）的音譯省稱，可表示土地或國土、世界。《華嚴經‧入法界品》：「嚴凈一切剎，滅除三惡道。」也表示佛塔頂部的飾物，亦稱剎柱。《說文新附》：「柱也。从刀，未詳。殺省聲。」 北魏楊衒之《洛陽伽藍記‧永寧寺》：「中有九層浮圖一所，架木為之，舉高九十丈；有剎復高十丈，合去地一千尺。」

　　「剎」也可指佛塔。《南齊書‧良政傳‧虞願》：「帝以故宅起湘宮寺，費極奢侈。以孝武莊嚴剎七層，帝欲起十層，不可立，分為兩剎，各五層。」

　　「剎」還指佛寺。唐顧況〈獨游青龍寺〉：「春風入香剎，暇日獨遊衍。」

　　「剎」還表示極短促的瞬間。南朝梁沈約〈千佛頌〉：「一剎靡停，三念齊往。」
humanum_short_description: 從「刀」，「殺」省聲，表示梵語剎多羅的音譯省稱。

剎 (Simplified: 刹)
Total strokes: 9; Radical: 刀
Pictophonetic: 杀 indicates the sound; 刂 (knife) conveys the meaning.
Character Formation:
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 杀 [ shā ] to kill, to murder, to slaughter; to hurt
    • 刂 [ dāo ] knife
  • Pinyin: shā

    English Definition: to brake
    Example Words:
    剎車 [ shā chē ]: to brake (when driving); to stop; to switch off; to check (bad habits); a brake
    剎把 [ shā bǎ ]: brake lever; crank handle for stopping or turning off machinery
    剎住 [ shā zhù ]: to stop; to come to a halt
    More: 剎* | *剎 | *剎*
  • Pinyin: chà

    English Definition: Buddhist monastery, temple or shrine (abbr. for 刹多罗 , Sanskrit "ksetra")

    剎時 [ chà shí ]: in a flash; in the twinkling of an eye

從「 刀 」，「 殺 」省聲，表示梵語剎多羅（ksetra）的音譯省稱，可表示土地或國土、世界。《華嚴經‧入法界品》：「嚴凈一切剎，滅除三惡道。」也表示佛塔頂部的飾物，亦稱剎柱。《說文新附》：「柱也。从刀，未詳。殺省聲。」 北魏楊衒之《洛陽伽藍記‧永寧寺》：「中有九層浮圖一所，架木為之，舉高九十丈；有剎復高十丈，合去地一千尺。」 「 剎 」也可指佛塔。《南齊書‧良政傳‧虞願》：「帝以故宅起湘宮寺，費極奢侈。以孝武莊嚴剎七層，帝欲起十層，不可立，分為兩剎，各五層。」 「 剎 」還指佛寺。唐顧況〈獨游青龍寺〉：「春風入香剎，暇日獨遊衍。」 「 剎 」還表示極短促的瞬間。南朝梁沈約〈千佛頌〉：「一剎靡停，三念齊往。」
From the " knife" and "to kill" to the provincial sound, it means the transliteration of the Sanskrit word ksetra (ksetra), which can mean land, country, or world. "Huayan Sutra‧ Entering the Dharma Realm": "Strictly clean all the temples and eliminate the three evil ways." It also means the ornaments on the top of the stupa, also known as the pillars. "Shuowen New Attachment": "The column also. From the knife, not detailed. Kill the province." The Northern Wei Dynasty Yang Xuan's "Luoyang Jialan Ji·Yongning Temple": "There is a nine-story floating map in the middle, and a wooden frame is ninety high. It is ten feet high with a brake, and a thousand feet together." " Sha" can also refer to a stupa. "The Book of Southern Qi‧The Biography of Liangzheng‧Yu Yuan": "The emperor used his old residence to build the Xianggong Temple. It was extremely extravagant. With filial piety and martial dignity, the emperor wanted to rise up to ten floors, and could not stand. It was divided into two temples, each with five floors. " " Sha" also refers to Buddhist temples. Tang Gu Kuang "A Trip to Qinglong Temple Alone": "The spring breeze enters the incense temple, and in his free day he travels alone. " Sha" also means a very short moment. Southern Dynasty Liang Shenyue "Ode to a Thousand Buddhas": "Stop for a moment, three thoughts go together."

剎字的基本解释

剎
chà
同“刹”。

剎
shā
同“刹”。

剎字的汉语字典释义

[①]［chà］
［《廣韻》初鎋切，入鎋，初。］
亦作“剎1”。亦作“剎2”。
(1)梵语刹多罗的音译省称。意为土地或国土、世界。
(2)梵语的音译省称。即相轮。佛塔顶部的饰物，亦称刹柱。
(3)指寺前的幡竿。
(4)指佛塔。
(5)指佛寺。
(6)梵语的省音译。表示极短促的瞬间。
[②]［shā］
犹煞。止住。

剎字的康熙字典解释

剎字的起名意思

暂无。

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［chà］
["Guang Yun" at the beginning of the cut, enter the beginning, the beginning. ]
Also known as "Brake 1". Also known as "Brake 2".
(1) The transliteration of the Sanskrit name of Shadala. It means land or country and world.
(2) Transliteration of Sanskrit provinces. That is the phase wheel. The ornament on the top of the stupa, also known as the brake pillar.
(3) Refers to the flag pole in front of the temple.
(4) Refers to the stupa.
(5) Refers to Buddhist temples.
(6) Provincial transliteration of Sanskrit. Represents a very short moment.
[②]［shā］
Yusha. stop.
